commit message: Fix #156: fiddly logic to extend keys over the top (/side) of the arrow portion.

Provide a static version.h for development builds.

I forgot to add this in last week's versioning revamp, meaning that
dev builds straight from source control would fail for lack of
version.h because Buildscr is the only thing that knows how to create
it. Other projects that I restructured this way come with a static
version of version.h so that local builds can still work; I forgot
that in this one.


git-svn-id: svn://svn.tartarus.org/sgt/puzzles@10274 cda61777-01e9-0310-a592-d414129be87e

WebView best practices from Dario Incalza's talk at xda:devcon.

Also be explicit about activities to export.

Part of #186: decide whether grid is allowed based on a resource, not screen metrics.

This gives a consistent answer, where previously, a screen close to 600dip might have got different answers depending on orientation, I guess because the navigation bar is not included.

Fix #185: highlight current game and scroll to it on resume.

Reluctantly introduce another view to hold a highlight colour, so the keyboard-focus rectangle can still appear around it.

Also tweak columns threshold so a 600dp-wide screen gets 2.
Fix #187: give bridges an l key to lock the current island.
Bind gamepad 'X' button to right click.
Gamepad: undo/redo on left/right shoulder buttons.

Fix #186 I hope: remove redundant clipping that became incorrect when zoom was added.

I'm surprised this didn't break on other devices.
Fix #184 again by making the overdraw an integer in all directions to get consistent behaviour.
